intro: Elaeoselinum apulia, commonly known as the Apulian celery, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like parsley and dill, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is valued for its aromatic foliage and has been used in traditional herbal medicine. Elaeoselinum apulia is also appreciated in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract beneficial insects.
